titleStmt.title: Letter July 8, 257 BC (docketed on the 10th)
titleStmt.author: Apollonios, dioiketes, 12 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p.292-293

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: Apollonios to Zenon, greeting. Take (the excess olive oil) which has accumulated with us out of the house to a market place and, having taken it (there, put it) in a warehouse which is as safe as possible. Then (appoint) some of the servants to guard it (until) those who have come from ---- (take it over?) to carry away.

listBibl.bibl: Pap.Lugd.Bat. XX 25, reedition of both fragments P.Cair.Zen. IV 59583 P.Col. III 14 P.Col.Zen. I 14 First publication of the combined texts by C.C. Edgar, Archiv 11 (1935) 218-19; R. Scholl, "Corpus der Ptolem*auischen Sklaventexte" (1990) no. 233
